TopicTitle: [1.12.x] End your parts list nightmare - Introducing The Janitor's Closet

Articles.Content:
12 hours ago, viperwolf said:

Thank you, we really appreciate the update!

If want to keep my saved blocked/perm items, can just copy the plugin data folder contents? 

I believe so

2 minutes ago, linuxgurugamer said:

I believe so

Yes it did work, but you also have to copy the .dat folder for the blocked items to still be blocked.

When you perma prune and export, is there way to save certain parts in different saves? What I mean is, I created an export called Original Perma. then created another export with a different name and different parts. However when i look at the folder it basically has all the parts from both prunes. Was that confusing?

23 hours ago, viperwolf said:

When you perma prune and export, is there way to save certain parts in different saves? What I mean is, I created an export called Original Perma. then created another export with a different name and different parts. However when i look at the folder it basically has all the parts from both prunes. Was that confusing?

No, not at this time

For some reason, Whenever I have this mod installed, everything I do in the editor is a double-click, making it impossible to do anything. Did I install it wrong or something? I don't know if it's related as well, but there are two "janitors closet" icons on the bottom of my screen.

19 minutes ago, Crazywolf5000 said:

For some reason, Whenever I have this mod installed, everything I do in the editor is a double-click, making it impossible to do anything. Did I install it wrong or something? I don't know if it's related as well, but there are two "janitors closet" icons on the bottom of my screen.

You have two copies ofmthe mod installed, or at lease two copies of the dll

Look at the log file, it will list in various places the different DLLs which are loaded.  Look for JanitorsCloset.dll

39 minutes ago, linuxgurugamer said:

You have two copies ofmthe mod installed, or at lease two copies of the dll

Look at the log file, it will list in various places the different DLLs which are loaded.  Look for JanitorsCloset.dll

I found it and it does appear twice but... now what? I'll be perfectly honest, I have no idea what I'm doing and I'd rather not break anything.

EDIT: never mind, I figured it out. If anyone is as big a noob at this as me is reading this, Once you find the log file (which in its self is a bit of an adventure) find the DLL using the Edit>find function in notepad, then copy-paste the path into your file explorer. Once there, just delete the duplicate mod. For me, this mod was included in another mod without me noticing, so it was causing things to break. Now that I've uninstalled the one that came bundled with it (in this case Airplanes Plus) everything is working fine. 

 

Edited March 24, 2018 by Crazywolf5000
I figured out how to fix it

@linuxgurugamer Im sending another small Donation to you next month for your work. The amount of mods you er maintaining seems pretty heavy to me. Thats alot of complaining, tweaking,time consuming stuff to deal with. Please dont burn yourself out, which is easy to do with so many different projects. Anyway I know you er probably tired of hearing this, but Thank you for your continued work!

This mod is useful, but also a bit infuriating I'm coming to find. Half the time I go into the VAB and try to select a part in the list, the "blocker Menu" pops up instead of me selecting/grabbing a part I want, absolutely driving me nuts. Am I missing something?

did you install Click Through Blocker dependency?

I tried deleting the settings that are created in both the mod directory (JanitorsCloset.cfg) and the individual save (JanitorsCloset.dat). I do have the required dependency of CTB.
